c74object.name: btoggle
c74object.description:
btoggle
is a JavaScript variant of toggle that accepts true, false, 0 and 1 as its input, and sends out true or false. Clicking on the object toggles between true and false.

method.name: int
method.description:
If the input is not 0,
toggle
displays an X, showing it is on, and sends out true. If it is
0
,
toggle
is blank, showing it is off, and sends out false.

method.name: (mouse)
method.digest:
A mouse click on
toggle
switches the object on if it is off/off if it is on.
method.description:
A mouse click on
toggle
switches the object on if it is off/off if it is on.

method.name: set
method.description:
Switches the
toggle
on or off without sending anything out the outlet. The word
set
, followed by any non-zero number or true, sets toggle to on;
set
0 or false sets it to off.

method.name: true
method.description: Sends out true and displays an x.

method.name: false
method.description: Sends out false and sets the display to blank.

example.caption: btoggle sends true or false in response to its input

entry.name: boolean
entry.description: Out left outlet: true or false
